subject: Add ability to initiate a Resource dump
commitMessage:
Add ability to initiate a Resource dump

The user will be able to initiate, view, and filter Resource dumps

Signed-off-by: Sneha Patel <Snehaben.Patel@ibm.com>
Change-Id: I10b5711210715c577127e220e7151047263c2ccb

Sukanya - Since you are taking over the story, you can also choose to abandon this story and start new if that makes the development and review process a little cleaner.

Abandoned

New patchset being created by Sukanya
We will want to remove this and rely on the editor to fix the code. It can also be fixed by running npm run lint.
Can  you name this createResourceDump? Also, I think you will want to remove the method on line 132.
Can we change this to getAllDumps? It is confusing since there is a BMC, System, and Resource dump and this action gets all of them so they can displayed on the screen.

BMC dump -> Lower case (d)ump and remove Entry
Hostboot dump -> Not needed until Hostboot dumps are supported. Can be removed until we add Hostboot dumps

https://ibm.invisionapp.com/share/CFO157T759W
Ok, We can remove Hostboot dump.

Can you remove this and update the message.

It should use imperative mood. The title should be no more than 5-52 characters and the body should not exceed 72 characters per line. A simple example would be.

Add Resource dump functionality

The user will be able to initiate, view, and download a resource dump.
Can we verify this content with the designers?
Why are these includes in this patchset? These are not related to dumps. Can you roll these back?
is this needed for your resource dump work?
We will want make this change as well to the state and getters

This was an old path. It changed, but should be the same as the other dumps

'/redfish/v1/Managers/bmc/LogServices/Dump/Actions/LogService.CollectDiagnosticData',
can you update this be better represent that it is filtering by date now that we have added another filter method? You can use event logos as an example.
This should be the same message as the start BMC dump.
Can we please remove this? we don't want to comment out lint.
Take a look at other errorToast since the store will send the error message to display.
You can remove this from the commit message. Gerrit shows if it is WIP
If no longer blocked you can remove this comment and add a comment describing the new updates you have added
I don't think this comment is needed
Will value ever equal 'Invalid Date' or will it be null or undefined if there is no date?
i'm not sure what this is here for. Can you discuss further with Dixsie.
we don't need the mock data. this can be removed

Already we are getting BmcDump Entries, I put 'resourceDumps' for mockdata entries. 
So, I removed it.
is this being used? if not it can be removed
you can remove this since you are getting this on line 27
You can remove this since you are getting this on line 28
is this related to this story? This should be removed

Sorry, I didn't notice.   
Yes, Removed.
Is this class needed or related?

we don't want to use
in our markup
a more specific id would be helpful like "input-resource". If you change it be sure to update the labels on 45

What does this do? If this is for validating the characters in the form field we should eb using vuelidate. Here is an example https://github.com/openbmc/webui-vue/blob/master/src/views/ProfileSettings/ProfileSettings.vue#L40

If the input field exceeds the 80 character limit we should show invalid feedback text. Here is an example: https://github.com/openbmc/webui-vue/blob/master/src/views/ProfileSettings/ProfileSettings.vue#L50
Is this needed or related to resource dumps? If not this should be removed.

Yes, this is related with Resource Dump. 
I have been told to hide for now because this is related with CE login.
Are these needed or related to resource dumps?

What is this for? Is this for min and max length? We should use vuelidate for validating 
here is an example https://github.com/openbmc/webui-vue/blob/master/src/views/ProfileSettings/ProfileSettings.vue#L179
this should be go below as per alphabetical order
why this change has been added
What kind of dumps are these, if they are required can you please put the comment on top, if not kindly remove them
Remove 'resourceDumps' and use 'bmcDumps' and use spread operator to combine the data of both the objects

I think it can be ok to use concat to combine the to arrays or use spread operator. However, system dumps are both hostboot and resource dumps. BMC dumps are just the BMC dumps. Those are the two service calls and not sure why there is any mock data here.

const allDumps = bmcDumps.concat(systemDumps);

Now no need to add 'resourceDumps', I removed it because I put it for just mock-data.
So, No need to use spread operator.
Kindly follow Dixsie comments for these.
Use imperative way of writing commit message
Why are we using two apis to fetch the data?
Using two same v-ifs, not able to understand the purpose ?
"for" value should be same as "id" for accessibility purpose, and moreover @derick can we have two labels for one input, will it not create hindrance for screen readers?
